intro: Brachystegia michelmorei, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and distinctive, clustered flowers. The tree typically grows in open woodlands and is adapted to seasonal climates with distinct wet and dry periods. Its bark is often fissured and may exude a milky sap when damaged. Brachystegia michelmorei plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
